There are numerous benefits to drinking water and staying hydrated:
- Boosts energy, immune system and brain function.
- Prevents and treats headaches.
- Maintains blood pressure.
- Promotes weight loss.
- Delivers oxygen throughout the body.
- Flushes out toxins and body waste.
- Improves physical performance.

What is the best way to cook with olive oil? 
- As part of a marinade.
- Drizzled over cooked pasta or vegetables.
- As part of a vinaigrette for salad dressings.
- Mixed with herbs to use as a bread dip.
- As part of a sauce.
- A replacement for butter in dessert recipes.
- As a finish or condiment.

Here are the nutrition facts for 100g of wheat flour:

Calories: 340 cal
Water: 11%
Protein: 13.2 g
Carbs: 72 g
Sugar: 0.4 g
Fiber: 10.7 g
Fat: 2.5 g

Protein content limits rising and spreading during baking.
To ensure that your baked goods turn out, look for recipes that already include wheat flour, or a mix of wheat and white flours.

Sugars added to food or drinks, and sugars found naturally in honey, syrups, and unsweetened fruit and vegetable juices, smoothies and purées should not make up more than 5% of the calories you get from food and drink each day.

Limit of free sugars per day:
Adults - 30g
Children aged 7 to 10 - 24g
Children aged 4 to 6 - 19g

Honey contains small amounts of a wide array of vitamins, minerals, amino acids and antioxidants, is a rich source of carbohydrates, provides a quick source of energy and is an effective antimicrobial agent.

When baking with honey, remember the following:
- Reduce liquid called for by 1/4 cup for each cup of honey used.
- Add 1/2 teaspoon baking soda for each cup of honey used.
- Reduce oven temperature by 25°F to prevent over-browning.
